New Records: Josh Naylor hit his 30th and 31st homers of the season, joining José Ramírez as the only two players on Cleveland’s roster with at least 30 homers. They are just the second Guardians duo in the past two decades to reach 30 homers and 100 RBIs in the same season, joining Ramírez and Edwin Encarnacion in 2018.
Key Match Events: Josh Naylor launched game-tying homers in the second and the seventh innings, the first of which was a Statcast-projected, 445-foot bomb into the right field seats.
Brayan Rocchio hit a walk-off single in the 10th inning to secure a 5-4 victory for the Guardians.
Pinch-hitter Kyle Manzardo knocked in a run on a single to center in the 10th inning.
Pinch-hitter Will Brennan delivered a game-tying RBI single to right field in the 10th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians outfielder Will Brennan expressed the team's determination and hunger to prove people wrong, highlighting the fun atmosphere in the clubhouse.
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt praised Josh Naylor's milestone of 30 homers and 100 RBIs, calling it a special achievement.
Guardians starter Tanner Bibee reflected on the return of the team's magic, describing it as unbelievable to watch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians spent all but seven days of the season in first place, experiencing plenty of success and high moments.
The Guardians could clinch a postseason berth with a win on Thursday.
